If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George "Gabby" Hayes, Sons of the Legion is a non-stop brilliant action film and perhaps Republic's best of 1937.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the animal, and the cat has to ask a local woman, who loves animals (Amy Locane) to help.
